column2: Self-motivated and self-oriented. Prefers to chart a personal course and encounters difficulties when others stand in the way. Values independence and enjoys solitude. Enjoyment of others' company is conditional on freedom for personal pursuits. A tendency toward egocentric and selfish behavior.

Identity and personal resources form the basis for all success. A need for inner security before engaging with the outer world. Family roots and the home environment provide the foundation for self-discovery, self-knowledge, and future success. A need to guard against becoming overly reclusive.

Interactions with others are of paramount importance. High value is placed on personal relationships and broader human interaction. A gift for mediation, stemming from insight into the nuances of relationships. Self-discovery primarily occurs within the context of relationships. A need to avoid being engulfed in stifling relationships.

Public life is the pinnacle. Personal satisfaction is gained from worldly achievements, and self-knowledge is learned through a position in the public arena. The need for a high public profile can be met through career and social status. A need to ensure achievements do not come at the expense of loved ones.
